title: The watchmaker, the exterminator, and the stonemason - perception of symbolic patterns in scripture
description: Looking at Joshua chapter 4, the Bible seems to assume that children can discern patterns in something as simple as a pile of stones. Yet many believe that there is no evidence for design or order in the natural world. We have to train our brains to believe that. Both materialists and theists rely on narrative and story to spread their viewpoint, but only one is considered mythology. Perhaps this is a mistake.
